responses.rationale: Factual description of risk level ('rare') and transmission ('can occur after close contact') without explicit framing cues.
Factual reporting of a severe statistic ('deaths of at least 25,000 turkeys') using neutral language.
Factual reporting of suspected spread mechanism ('thought to be spreading') and detection ('dozens tested positive').
Factual historical reporting of emergence, outbreaks ('large outbreaks' is scale, not amplified impact), and spread.
Factual reporting of locations of cases without explicit framing cues.
Factual reporting of consequences ('triggered more restrictions', 'blocking poultry products') using neutral verbs.
Factual reporting of actions taken ('limited poultry purchases') due to an event ('outbreak').
Factual reporting of actions taken ('banning or limiting poultry imports') following an event ('disease outbreak').
Factual reporting of locations and dates of findings ('was found') without explicit framing cues.
Factual reporting of date, event ('was detected'), location, and animal type without explicit framing cues.
